Entry.1: – Finished old diary and sent it with Johnson (who has gone to leave to England) to be sent to Doff
Entry.2: Went around trenches, B Coy a
Entry.3: General Work – relief by 19th Battn only partly carried out – 5000 yards of trenches dug in night
Entry.4: Relief completed by 12 midnight – very tired
Entry.5: Empire Day had a letter from Florrie 23/6/15 11 months Had hot bath, saw the General and had a long yarn
Entry.6: Wrote a long letter to Doff Things very quiet, but had a "Stand to" at 3 AM
Entry.7: Visited the billet also saw Lloyd Field Artillery also Had dinner with .
Entry.8: Had a hot bath and went to Amenities after, bought a new Razor. Colonel Watson dined with us.
Entry.9: three men wounded by Bomb explosion at Hdqrs. Billets transferred Hdqrs from LaRolandiere Farm to Canteen Farm.
Entry.10: Streaky Bacon Far, Billet. shelled by Enemy 8 men wounded. Wrote to Doff. Went up to Trenches with Capt Clover Re Trench Had a long letter from
Entry.11: Board of Enquiry on damage to Streaky Bacon Farm. Frizell had dinner with us.
Entry.12: A bit off color. Finished Court of Enquiry on Farm
Entry.13:
sent a cable to Doff saying "All well best love you & Billie" Lunched with Sharp Craft battery – had hot bath

Hostile shelling of 20th Battery. One of our balloons got loose occupants descended in parachute
Entry.14: Quiet day generally Major Martin promoted to Lieut Colonel from 19/4/16.
Entry.16: Received message from the General congratulating me on D.S.O. – General CNMG Paton CB Watson & Fitzgerald & Wisdom DSO – Heavy shelling on both Flanks at 6.30 pm
Entry.17: Quiet day, Lowther slightly wounded, and two other ranks (one seriously). Stood to Arms from 8.30 pm to 1.30 AM on account of raid by 7th Bde which failed to come off. very cold
Entry.18: Quiet day until bombardment by Artillery at 11.15 pm for raid by 7th Brigade Artillery. Opened on several points and then concentrated on area to be raided. German retabation killed 5 and wounded 6 of our men. Raid a success 2 men killed & 3 wounded of party. Wrote to Mrs Gray
Entry.19: Went around Trenches Had a letter from Genl Birdwood congratulating me on DCO. Wrote to Doff
Entry.20: Fairly quiet day one man wounded one killed
Entry.21: Two scouts wounded by M.G. from A Battalion
Entry.22: In charge of Practice Party Heritage, Kirke, Heath, Lane, Byrne, Harper, Fay, Dooker, Wallach being officers. Commenced with men
Entry.23: Started work in earnest. had a hot bath early, layout fighting, Bombing etc.
Entry.24: More work, trenches well under way, lectures etc saw the General at night
Entry.25: Had a letter from Doff shifted into Bombing School Men working hard.
Entry.26: Wrote to Doff – Men still going strong, and getting into fine fettle.
Entry.27: Trenches nearly ‘completed’ team finally selected saw 7th Bde at work
Entry.28:
Saw Ivanell D Kay 
shifted into to bed 
 Things working well
Entry.29:
Trenches completed first practice by daylight. wrote orders, gas alarm 
Sunda
 at night, Had a cable from Doff & Florrie
Entry.30: Church Parade, saw Twynan & Telvey, work on Trenches in afternoon & evening. Cable from Jay.
Entry.31: Saw C Cowes, Byrne, Smith & Frizell, also Man re stunt. Practice at night.
Entry.32: Saw Col Cannon, things shaping well, Colonel wisdom slightly wounded & evacuated, dinner given by Col Martin. Practice at night.
Entry.33: Practice going strong. Visited by Genl Monash and his B.M. practice at night. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.34: Practice at night Genl Legge & Genl Holmes came along. All pleased.
Entry.35: Jackson saw men at work – raining. no practice at night
Entry.36: Saw Jack Russell-Jones. went to trenches. Full dress rehearsal.
Entry.37: Final talk with officers & men stunt starts at 11.30 pm.
Entry.38: Raid a great success captured 4 Prisoners Killed several & blew up bomb store 14 casualties on our side from shells. Heath wounded 1 Sgt Killed, and 12 others wounded, all brought back. General very pleased. Raid by 18th Battalion tonight.
Entry.39: 18th Battn a great success too: General is delighted with Brigade. I am now assisting 4th Brigade for a few days.
Entry.41: wrote despatch – and went for a ride, saw 9th Battalion Co. Robertson
Entry.44: Letter from Florrie Doff’s letter mikslaid, more about board re revolvers
Entry.45: Church Parade, visited by Alex McKenzie, wrote a letter to Doff. Saw men at football.
Entry.46: Finished letter to Doff. Also received a letter from Doff.
Entry.47: Quiet day generally, went to Croix Du Bac.
Entry.48: Saw Black, had dinner with him, Smith returned yesterday Another letter from Doff
Entry.49:
Battalion Competitions in Marching, Rifle Exercises, Bomb Throwing & Bayonet Fighting – I acted as Judge

Went for a rise with Marton. had to gallop through shell fire – played Bridge at night.
Entry.50: Quiet day generally, had a few kickes at fooball orders to move on 9th.
Entry.51: Went for a ride to Steenwerck amd visited Transport Lines. Wrote to Doff off tomorrow.
Entry.52: Marched from L’Halloban to Strazelle through Steenwerck etc. 13 ½ miles
Entry.53: Marched to Eblinghem 12 miles some trouble re Billets – saw Watson & also the General.
Entry.54: Left Eblinghem at 10 am for St Omer entrained at 5 pm & left there for Amiens
Entry.55:
Arrived at Longwau and detrained at 2 AM marched

through Amiens to Argveuves, now in billet at a beautiful Chateau
Entry.56: Martin went by car to reconnoitre – Troops having a spell – have marched 42 miles so far. Wrote to Doff
Entry.57: Visited Amiens and has a good look around saw the Cathedral – France Day
Entry.58: Had a letter & some photos from Doff – saw the General moving soon now
Entry.59: Received orders at 11 AM to March at Noon to Cardonuette through Poulainville – 7 miles Billets crowded and not so comfortable. Martin upset raining. Dowlings Horse bolted
Entry.60: Raining all day – gave lectures to companies on Wool & Village fighting
Entry.61: Marched to Rubeinpre – 8 miles billets much better saw the General
Entry.62: Company Training etc – visited Wisdom leaving tomorrow – Had a cable from Doff "stored furniture staying Edie couple months probably board Weldon on return all well"
Entry.63: Left for Warloy 8 miles arriving 12 noon – Saw General who had latest news from Sherbon dated 5/6/15
Entry.64: Went to a lecture on use of M Guns at Rubeinpre, in afternoon took half Ballalion for Route march ro Valencies 8 miles – Had a letter from Sherbon
Entry.65:
– Wrote to Doff and Mother Marched to Albert (6 miles) 1st Division making attack on 

Poziers. Bivouaced in large Chalk Quarries
Entry.66: Went to church Parade Baz sick, had to bivouac again very cold.
Entry.67: Went for a ride around Albert with the General. left for Sausage Valley near Contalmaison, now in Trenches (old German)
Entry.68:
Saw Geoff McLoughlin. reconnoitra ground to Contalmaison & Poziers Battalion went into line. I 
left
 remained at Bde Hdqrs
Entry.69: Sent up water & bombs all day, very hard fighting Battalion doing well but a lot of Casualties.
Entry.70:
Going all night – saw the Colonel early – sent 80 stretcher bearers up our

casualties 7 Officers 240 other ranks
Entry.71:
Sent up to organise an attack on German Trenches. our casualties very large.

Saturday 29/7/16 Attack of whole Division failed Our Battalion have suffered very badly. 7th Brigade didn’t reach
Entry.73: 160 men came into Sausage Valley for a rest – no work of relief.
Entry.74: quiet night less number of casualties. Some men out for a spell.
Entry.75: – Papers returned re Jackson of Raiding Party Colonel looks tired, have taken his place in the line.
Entry.76:
Bombed up O.G. 1 towards Railway but forced to Withdraw, very heavily

shelled. Colonel Martin came up again & I returned to Brigade Headquarters through Hun Barrage
Entry.77: Had a good sleep for about 3 hours men looking very tired – had a letter from Doff
Entry.78: Attack on OG 1 and 2 by whole Division a great success I reinforced Martin with remainder Battalion.
Entry.79: Took charge of digging in party – relieved by 45th Battery (Herring) at 6 pm – We went to Tara Hill – one man killed there by shells.
Entry.80: Inspection of Brigade by Birdwood – then we marched to Warloy.
Entry.81: – Had a bath, rested the day, saw the General, saw Watson in Hospital wotj Shell shock – Manning having been Killed
Entry.82: Marched from Warloy to La Vicogne, 12 miles. Bivouaced in a beautiful orchard.
Entry.83: Marched to Halloy & passed 1st Division who are returning to firing line. saw Corlette.
Entry.84: Commenced re-organisation and training of Baarralion saw Corlette & General.
Entry.85: Corlette had dinner with us – wrote to Doff
Entry.86: Feeling very down hearted – saw the General letter from Florrie
Entry.87: Married two years today. I wish Doff Many Happy Returns – went with Smith & Middleton to Amiens for the afternoon. letter from Mrs Tye.
Entry.88: More Training – Went for a ride with the Colonel & finally visited the ancient excavations (renounded in History) of Naours
Entry.89: Battalion Sports very interesting and amusing afternoon – Boxing, Pillow Fight –Wrestling on horseback. Tug of War on Horseback & throwing Cricket ball. Orders to proceed to La Vicogne & Rubempre tomorrow
Entry.90: Marched from Halloy to La Vicogne – bivouacked in same Chateau Garden – had a game of Solo – Rained all night.
Entry.91: Marched at 8.30 am for Harponville (10 miles) arriving at 1 pm Wrote a letter to Doff.
Entry.92: Battalion training finished letter to Doff - now Temp Major Spier a Captain
Entry.93: Two years today since leaving for German War guinea leaving tomorrow
Entry.94: March via Warloy and Albert to Sausage Gully 14 miles – One man wounded.
Entry.95: Battalion took over Res Trenched from 5th Battalion I remained in Reserve
Entry.96: Went up to the Front saw Martin also the General
Entry.97: Quiet day in dugout Shelled heavily by the Hun – wrote to Bas.
Entry.98: visited to Colonel & the front line – now on top of hill – straped well coming back saw the General
Entry.99:
Wrote to Doff – saw 
Doff
 General coming out of trenches tomorrow move out Road
Entry.100: Came out ahead of Battalion to the Brickfields to fix up Bivouac – Battn still in saw the General.
Entry.101: Battn went to TARA Hill wounded a 12 months
Entry.102: Saw General – letter from Doff – Battn at Brickfields – leaving for WArloy tomorrow raining heavily.
Entry.103: Wet day marched to Warloy – roads very heavy Had dinner with Spier at ‘D’ Coy.
Entry.104: Review of Brigade (postponed) by General Birdwood saw the General wrote to Doff
Entry.105:
Genl Birdwood presented medals for Poziers – 1 DSO 2 MC, 5 DCM & 9 MM – myself on Court Martial –Battalion.

marched to Bouval 14 miles I rode after dart to rejoin very long & tiresome rid, back a buster arrived 1 AM
Entry.106: Saw Brigade then went to 4th Army at Toutencourt re Court-Martial – had dinner at Doullions (very nice one).
Entry.107: Finished Court Martial cases – Received a cable from Doff "Both Splendid Billee crawling everywhere"
Entry.108: Went to Brigade church Parade wrote to Doff
Entry.109: Feeling off color moving tomorrow – very wet- saw the General
Entry.110: Moved at 6 AM to Doullens Ypres area – detrained at Poperinghe at 4 PM very bad cold.
Entry.111: Had a look at the town, also had a hot bath – still off color went to bed early
Entry.112: Colonel visited trenches had breakfast in bed Went to Picture Show saw game of bowls. going into line tomorrow.
Entry.113: Wrote to Doff – sent a cable to Doff – Both well Best love you and Billee. Proceeded by train to Ypres Billet in Barracks, Rampart & Bund
Entry.114: Had a look around Battn Took over line from Rifle Bde.
Entry.115: Hdqrs La Tuilerey ( Brick Kiln) visited CB, & D Coys by night
Entry.116:
Visit from General who said he had received a cable from Billee wishing him Manly Happy Returns

Had a letter from Mother
Entry.117: Pte Jackson awarded V.C. for work during raid. Went around trenches with Smith of 2nd in C 23rd Battalion – letter from Doff
Entry.118: Beurs slightly wounded & evacuated – on board of Enquiry re man shooting himself in foot (accident)
Entry.119: Relieved by 23rd Battalion Battalion billets at Barracks Hdqrs at Ramparts
Entry.120: Went to Div. Hdq at Reninghelst on Board of Enquiry – dined at Mess & returned by Car at 10 pm. Saw General – had letter from Doff.
Entry.121: Wrote to Doff. Quiet day otherwise got cheque from Smith for cash for Tailor
Entry.122: No church parade on account of danger of shells. General decorated with Russian Order of St Anne.
Entry.123:
Reorganised snipers had a game of cards saw letter 
from
 to General from Doff enclosing a lovely photo on ‘pierrot’
Entry.124: Played Bridge with Smith and Padre – going into line tomorrow night
Entry.125: Colonel Martin going on leave today – wrote to Mother & also Doff
Entry.126:
Took over from 19th last night – visited trenched took 5 hours to go around. Saw the General – now at Valley Cottages.


Wednesday
Entry.127: Went round trenches saw General also took D.D.M.S. around
Entry.128: Quiet day until night 1 man wounded 1 Killed by Minenwerfer
Entry.129: Went around trenches meeting of Battn Cmdrs at 18th Hq.
Entry.130: Visited by Gen;. Birdwood Andrew Fisher & Col Anderson. Trench mortar & Artillery duel Wrote to Doff – received a letter from Doff later.
Entry.131: Had a hard day around trenches, more French mortars 6 men killed.
Entry.132: Relieved by 19th Battalion and went to Ypres in billets again – Bas back also "Tiny" Heath.
Entry.133: Had a good rest - saw the General & had a long talk with him. raid by 18th failed Lane wounded by bomb
Entry.134: Visited men in billets and made fresh arrangements Johnson back as Adjutant.
Entry.136:
Bn. Raiding party at work under Heath wrote to Doff – Clock put back 1 hour 
Wrote Doff
Entry.137: Quiet day visited Barracks Had a long talk with Bas
Entry.138: Things very quiwt but a a lot of fatigues
Entry.139: Martin returned had a talk with the General re several matters.
Entry.140: Received some sox & things from Home. Had a hot bath 19th Raid tonight.
Entry.141: 19th Raid a success but no prisoners taken – Gas alarm at night
Entry.142: Handed over to 25th Battalion and left Ypres by train at 10 pm.
Entry.143: Arrived at 4 am at Winnizelle after a mess up of billets had to sleep in open for a couple of hours.
Entry.144: Had a letter and photo from Doff – saw the General at Steinworde – he is going on leave tomorrow. wrote to Doff.
Entry.145: Took over command of 18th from Wisdom moving billets tomorrow.
Entry.146: Shifted billets had a good look around went to Padre Fernies Birthday dinner Party Martin Mayham Bas Frizell Johnson Mather & Smith
Entry.147: Orders received to move to Poperinghe tomorrow
Entry.148: Battalion moved to Popat & parade grounds.
Entry.149: Things beginning to look ship shape 0 went to a Picture show & Pierrot concert & had a good dinner with George Smith.
Entry.150: Moving again tomorrow. Went to a Picture show with Martin & laterbouht him a dinner.
Entry.151: Moved at 9 AM to Reningholst now in Canadian Camp called Chippewa. Wrote to Doff & sent some lace to her.
Entry.152: Put men through bath Orders received to march tomorrow. Poll re conscription
Entry.153: Marched to Steenvoorde Abule arrived at 3 PM. Old billets
Entry.154: commenced Courts Martial cases at STEENVOORDE Brigade moved to Arneke
Entry.155: finished Courts Martial rose with Baz to Winnizelle
Entry.156:
Left Steenvoorde to rejoin Battalion arrived at Cassel for lunch & arrived at Arneke at 4 pm. moving tomorrow

Saturday 21/10/16 In charge 18th moved to Nordasgues a
Entry.157: miles everyone did splendidly. Col Wisdom on leave. General not back yet. returning on Monday.
Entry.158: Quiet day but very cold had a letter from Doff enclosing a lock of Bille’s hair. Had a photo taken on Friday. Wrote to Doff
Entry.159: Orders to entrain tomorrow for Pont Remy on Somme. made a reconnainace as far as AUDRIUCO place of entrainment beautiful weather.
Entry.160: Marched to BALLENCOURT 6 miles – Had dinner with Martin at Chateau at PONT REMY
Entry.161: Saw General now back with Brigade – Proceeded by Motor bus to Rebimont after a march in rain arrived at village at 11 PM
Entry.162: Saw Barney Sommemrville. men rested all day.
Entry.163: Saw General re Divisional School, had a letter from Florriw, had dinner with General present also McKenzie, Martin, Ralston, Moslet Henderson and Hale (who leaves fro England)
Entry.164: Had two more photos from Doff – Wrote to Doff
Entry.165: Went for a ride to HEILLY with Martin. had a long talk with the General
Entry.166: Went up in a Monoplane 2000 feet, very exciting. Murphy returned to Battn I am rejoining 17th tomorrow
Entry.167: Went for a walk with Padre to HEILLY now with 17th again, made a small reconnaissance. Sent a cable to Billie for birthday
Entry.168: Raining heavily all training postponed. Went for a bath with Bas and Smith to HEILLY
Entry.169: Practice of Bde in cooperation with aircraft contact patrols leaving tomorrow
Entry.170: Marched at 8 A.M. to MAMETZ Area – congestion & Road traffic enormous – very muddy
Entry.171: Moved up at 7 AM to Div Reserve for Stunt – Paton wounded also Fitzgerald late 20th – after bitterly cold day returned to Billets.
Entry.172: Wrote to Doff – Went into line taking over from 26th 27th & 23rd Trenches in a frightful condition.
Entry.173: Feeling very sick went to see Smith at R.A.P stopped the night with him.
Entry.174:
Went back to line but felt rotten Came out

and returned about 9 AM to rest billets.
Entry.175: – Still off color, had a hot bath – wrote to my son this being his Birthday
Entry.176: Battalion came out of line during last night. Feeling aa bit better. Wrote to Doff
Entry.177: – Feeling better – went to see the Colonel and had a talk generally
Entry.178: Had a letter from Doff Battalion moved to Mametz now fit again
Entry.179: Quiet Day generally had a rest played Cards at night.
Entry.180: – Quiwwt Day letter from Horne – attack by 19th
Entry.181: 0 Went up to see about fatigues Battalion moved to Montalan Sherbon Killed
Entry.182: Quiet day had a game of cards
Entry.183: Had a long talk with the General who told me I am likely tto be d=sent to command the 25th Batallion.
Entry.184: Battalion moved to Carlton. Camp at 9 AM & after a very tiresome day I led them to Adr. Brig. H.Q. where I handed them over to Guides & returned.
Entry.185: Returned to Camp at 8 AM very tired – slept all day
Entry.186: Quiet day – very bad cold remained inside all day
Entry.187: Saw Marsden also Davies from RM College. Went to Carlton Camp & met the Battalion – shelled all night – evryone very tired
Entry.188: Entrained at Montaalan and detrained at Meaulte then marched over to Ribemont.
Entry.189: Went to Amiens had an adventure with the Prince of Wales
Entry.190: Went to the R.F.C. Squadron & saw the Fellows, had a fly – went to Heilly had a bath saw Corlette
Entry.191: General gone on 6 days leave – he is to get the 9th Div in January – on Court Martial cases
Entry.193: Inspected Battalion by Companies – Martin sick also Bas
Entry.194: Inspected Transport, Kitchens etc – Full Marching order parade of Battalion I am inspection by myself had a parcel from Doff
Entry.195: Sent at 1.2 hours notice to take command of the 26th Battalion relieved O’Donnell.
Entry.196: Entrained at Bure for Vignacourt at 1 pm. arrived at 7 p.m.
Entry.197: 1/121/6 Commenced Training & reorganisation, short of Officers.
Entry.198: Inspection of billets vy Colonel Wisdom. Ssaturday half holiday.
Entry.199: Church Parade – Lecture at Div. School Flesselles by Brigade – saw General
Entry.200: Training proceeding satisfactorily Musketry etc. Promoted Lt Col Tempy
Entry.201: Wrote to Doff. Saw Colonel Wisdom re promotions – Training hard.
Entry.202: Received a letter from Doff also one from Sherbon
Entry.203: Battalion practised close order drill etyc went to a lecture at Flesselles on Somme Offensive.
Entry.204: Raining, Inspection by Brigadier postponed prepared lecture on Map Reading for Div. School
Entry.205: Raining – inspection of billets by Brigadier. wrote to Doff, also the Duchess. Received letter from Doff
Entry.206: Raining – Went to Flesselles to lecture at Div. School
Entry.207: Gave a lecture at Div School on Map Reading & Filed sketching
Entry.208: inspection by Brigadier in snow – much improvement shows – had a cable from Billie
Entry.209: Brigade Practice Attack in conjunction with aeroplane contact patrol gave a Lecture to Bde on Map Reading & Filed Sketching – Battalion Concert at Cinema Hall at night
Entry.210: Training proceeding – musketry Lewis Guns & Bombing also Rapid wiring.
Entry.211: Orders to move received Transport tomorrow remained of Battalion on Monday – heard from General wrote to Doff
Entry.212: Transport moved to Buire Church Parade – Battalion moving tomorrow
Entry.213: 18/112/16 Battalion entrained at 9 AM & arrived at Buire at noon received 150 Reinforcements Did not get into Billers until 3.30 p.m.
Entry.214:
Saw the General, discussion re untrained Reinforcements am detailed to train for the Division

Wednesday 20/12/16 Inspection of Battalion by General Legge – left by car to reconnoitre Bussy – had a smash near 3rd F.C. Aerodrome Dinner with Black at 7th F.A.
Entry.215: Member of F.G. CM on Lt Norris of
Entry.216: Battn left for Bussy arriving after dark – nothing to be done
Entry.217: Commenced organising & cleaning up generally Things very muddled.
Entry.218: Drill (Squads) in morning march in Afternoon – Gen Wisdom arrived.
Entry.219: visit to Amiens with Wisdom – Drill in afternoon
Entry.220: 0 Inspected Billets with the General Genl left in afternoon. Wrote to Doff
Entry.221: Men Paid – Parades as usual – Talk at night
Entry.222: Men passed into "b" Class visited by Gen White – Talk at night
Entry.223: More men passed into "B" Class – 30 yds range in hand – Bombing pit fix
Entry.224: 30 yds Range, Bayonet course, & bombing well in hand – Gen; Wisdom arrived.
Entry.225: Passed men to "C" Class visited Amiens in afternoon with Wisdom met Watson
Entry.226: Went to see site for Rifle Range near corbie wisdom left after lunch Wrote to Doff
